user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_CondVarGetInfo:
```c
int32 OS_CondVarGetInfo(osal_id_t var_id, OS_condvar_prop_t *condvar_prop)
{
    OS_common_record_t *record;
    int32               return_code;
    OS_object_token_t   token;

    /* Check parameters */
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(condvar_prop);

    memset(condvar_prop, 0, sizeof(OS_condvar_prop_t));

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_GLOBAL, OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONDVAR, var_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        record = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_global_condvar_table, token);

        strncpy(condvar_prop->name, record->name_entry, sizeof(condvar_prop->name) - 1);
        condvar_prop->creator = record->creator;

        return_code = OS_CondVarGetInfo_Impl(&token, condvar_prop);

        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_CondVarGetInfo:
#define OS_CHECK_POINTER(ptr) BUGCHECK((ptr)!=NULL,OS_INVALID_POINTER)
...
int32 OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_lock_mode_t lock_mode, osal_objtype_t idtype, osal_id_t id, OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    int32 return_code;

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdTransactionInit(lock_mode, idtype, token);
    if (return_code != OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return return_code;
    }

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdToArrayIndex(idtype, id, &token->obj_idx);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        token->obj_id = id;

        /*
         * The "ConvertToken" routine will return with the global lock
         * in a state appropriate for returning to the caller, as indicated
         * by the "check_mode" parameter.
         *
         * Note If this operation fails, then it always unlocks the global for
         * all check_mode's other than NONE.
         */
        return_code = OS_ObjectIdConvertToken(token);
    }

    if (return_code != OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        OS_ObjectIdTransactionCancel(token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
...
void OS_ObjectIdRelease(OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    OS_ObjectIdTransactionFinish(token, NULL);
}
...
int32 OS_CondVarGetInfo_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token, OS_condvar_prop_t *condvar_prop)
{
    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
extern OS_common_record_t *const OS_global_condvar_table
...
typedef struct OS_common_record OS_common_record_t
...
typedef struct
{
    char      name[OS_MAX_API_NAME];
    osal_id_t creator;
} OS_condvar_prop_t
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
...
#define OS_INVALID_POINTER (-2)
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONDVAR 0x0D
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No statically unreachable code fragments were found in the provided function. Rationale:

- There are no unconditional return statements, goto jumps, or compile-time constant conditions that prevent later statements from ever being reached.
- The main conditional (if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)) is a runtime-dependent branch — both entering and skipping the block are possible depending on the result of OS_ObjectIdGetById, so the code inside is reachable at runtime and therefore not statically unreachable.
- The OS_CHECK_POINTER macro expands to a runtime check (BUGCHECK((ptr)!=NULL,...)); although it may abort on a NULL pointer at runtime, this does not make the subsequent code statically unreachable in the project source.
- Helper functions/macros used (OS_ObjectIdGetById, OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET, OS_CondVarGetInfo_Impl, OS_ObjectIdRelease) are normal runtime calls and do not introduce compile-time-unreachable code in this translation unit. OS_CondVarGetInfo_Impl currently returns OS_SUCCESS, but that is an implementation detail and does not make any code in the caller impossible to reach under different implementations or runtime conditions.

Given these points, there are no code fragments in this function that meet the MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 definition of unreachable code that should be investigated further.
